fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the Apps > Manage apps > System, a few apps show *${project.name}* with unknown vendor details

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Jira > Apps > Manage apps > System
# A few apps show ${project.name} and unknown vendor 

h3. Expected Results
Since the apps under System and manged by Atlassian, the apps listed here should have appropriate names and vendor details

h3. Actual Results
System apps show name as ${project.name} and unknown vendor

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: System apps shows ${project.name} under Apps > Manage apps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On clicking connected apps, we see an error - Something went wrong

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to admin.atlassian.com
# Click on connected apps

h3. Expected Results
It should load fine

h3. Actual Results
It throws error: "Something went wrong
Try again later.
"
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Connected apps section under user management throws error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When transitioning a Jira issue status manually to a state that has a screen in Jira that require manual input, an error message is thrown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project in Jira
 # Create a screen
 #* On the Jira project, click on the cog icon at the top right corner
 #* Select "Issues"
 #* Open the tab "Screens"
 #* Click on "Add Screen"
 #* Put any fields (e.g. Description and Summary)
 # Add the new Screen to the workflow
 #* Go to the "Workflow" tab
 #* Click on "Edit" for the project you want to add the screen
 #* On the Diagram flow, click on the "arrow" of any status and click "Edit"
 #* In the dropdown for screens, add the screen created
 #* Click publish the draft.
 # Create a new Issue
 # Go to Bitbucket, add the issue key to a Commit or Pull Request
 # Open the Issue Key and change it to the status the screen was created

h3. Expected Results
A new pop up to provide the information for that screen would show up.
h3. Actual Results
An error message is generated

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Transitioning state from within Bitbucket of a Jira Issue key that has a Multi-line text field added to the workflow throws a "XSRF Security Token Missing" error

fields.description:
*Issue:* Currently the shortcuts we create in Jira (when clicked) open in a new tab when using the browser-based version (only one available to our work).

*Why it matters?* We use shortcut links a lot to quickly navigate to a specific topic both in Jira and Confluence. Navigating back and forth using these shortcuts create many tabs that are cumbersome to stop and close, not to mention the wasted computer resources used with multiple tabs open.

*Suggestion*: Allow us to choose whether these Jira Shortcuts open in a new window/tab or the same page.
fields.summary: Enable a choice for Jira Shortcuts opening in a new window/tab or same page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Adding only attachments to the description using the old issue view makes the field hard to edit in the new issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to the old issue view and add 3 PDF files as attachments to the issue
# Edit the description of the issue and add the 3 files attached and save it
# Go to the new issue view and click on the description field to edit it


h3. Expected Results

The field editing is enabled

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens

h3. Workaround

Click on the are below the attachments or go to the old issue view, edit the description and add some break lines after the files
fields.summary: Adding only attachments to the description using the old issue view makes the field hard to edit in the new issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

All the available options under the Label field are not accessible on the create issue screen when accessing the site on the Windows Machine on the create issue. The option to _press down to select a suggested label_ would be inaccessible. This would happen if the field is at the bottom of the create issue page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add the _label_ field at the bottom of the create issue screen of any classic project
 !Label.png|thumbnail!
 # (Use Windows Machine)
 # Create an issue and use the _press down_ option on the label field

h3. Expected Results

The label field either list all the options or should enable the scroll button to access all the available options.
h3. Actual Results

Options are beyond the screen canvas and can't be accessed on the create issue screen
 !ScreenShot.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
 * Begin typing to find and add the labels.
 * Or, move the label field in the middle of the screen
fields.summary: All labels are not accessible in the create issue screen on Windows machine

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If the visibility of profile picture is set to an organization, Automation for Jira does not show it on rule list screens, both Global config and Project roles, even if it is your own organization. The visibility of profile picture has to be set to Anyone to show it on rule list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Set visibility of profile picture to an organization
Create an Automation rule
Check list of rules to see that profile picture is not shown

h3. Expected Results
Profile picture is shown if visibility is set to organization

h3. Actual Results
Profile picture is not shown if visibility is set to organization

The below exception is thrown:
N/A

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Profile pictures not showing on Automation for Jira list of rules

fields.description:
Two wishes:
 # Rename the option "Current fields" to "Default fields"

          This would reflect more precisely what happens when selecting that, as it does _not_ export what fields one has currently in view, but the default set of columns.

       2. Add an export option to actually export the columns in the current view

A saved search allows one to have different selection of columns without it affecting the default selection. This is really good e.g. when looking at computer type tickets vs. some service type. One doesn't need to know (and the ticket does not contain) the same info on both.

Default selection is good when searching quickly for some info, good to have wide variety of columns.
fields.summary: Export - Fields included in exports needs some tweaking

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As an admin, I would like to be able to define a value limit that can be used in the Story Points field. 

The reason for that is that this field accepts any number and it is possible to estimate issues with 1000+ Story Points and this can cause reports, such as Burndown Chart, Release Burndown, or even Version Burndown gadgets to be misleading.
fields.summary: Add the ability to set a limit in the Story Points field

fields.description:
Renderer settings don't affect the [new Jira issue view|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/changes-to-issues-in-the-new-issue-view-966684842.html], which uses markdown for rich text fields.

Would be nice to be able to use the default text renderer.
fields.summary: Allow the default text renderer to be used in the new issue view
Improve CSV export to render user names in the Comments field

fields.description: It'd be great to have a gadget for the new roadmap feature (https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/enable-the-roadmap/) able to be added to a dashboard.
fields.summary: New roadmap gadget for dashboards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

During the project deletion process, Jira also deletes issues and their attachments (among other things). Jira fires webhook events for every attachment deleted.

Due to Project Trash changes, this now fails with an NPE.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project, add an attachment to any of its issues.
 # Move the project to trash.
 # Attempt to permanently delete the project.

h3. Expected Results

The project is deleted.
h3. Actual Results

An error screen shows up. Logs indicate that an NPE occurred.
h3. Workaround

Try the deletion again, it should work.

There is currently no way to cause the webhook events to trigger.

If none of those work, you can restore the project and delete it using the [Delete project|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-projects/#api-rest-api-3-project-projectidorkey-delete] endpoint. That deletes the project permanently. That works since it does not go trough the trashing process.
fields.summary: Attachment delete webhooks throw an error when a project is deleted

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the Jira label custom field, only 20 items are displayed by default. So in case, more than 20 values are present, a user will have to type the value to show the hidden matching entries. However, the user does not have a way to know if there are additional values except by typing.
h3. Suggested Solution

Put a hint to the user that additional data is present when there are more than 20 values in the label field. There is a similar feature available in the 'Fix versions' field.
fields.summary: Enhanced search for Jira label custom fields.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While attempting to convert an issue to sub-task, I can't select the parent from the drop-down

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to convert an issue into sub-task
# At step 2, search by the issue, it will be displayed as a suggestion at the drop-down
# Try to select it from the drop-down and it doesn't allow to select

h3. Expected Results
Selecting from drop-down should fill the parent box and allow to continue with converting the issue into a sub-task

h3. Actual Results
Unable to select, thus, doesn't allow to proceed into converting the issue into a sub-task

h3. Workaround
Was able to pass this by entering the full issue key at the parent box by ignoring the suggestion
fields.summary: While attempting to convert an issue to sub-task, I can't select the parent from the drop-down

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you add an attachment to a comment, the history doesn't create an entry for that event.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Press the "M" key on the keyboard to add a comment
# Drag file into the comment section or click on the "Files & images" icon
# Click *Save*

h3. Expected Results

An entry in the history is created informing that an attachment was added

h3. Actual Results

The history shows no entries related to attachments

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Adding attachments to comments using the new issue view doesn't add registries to the issues' history

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Issues are not associated to the correct workflow when the issue type is updated by an Automation Rule

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Next-gen project
 # Create 2 issue types with different workflows
# Create a rule to change issue type
# Create an issue with one type 
# Trigger the rule to change the issue's type
# The issue transitions will be the ones available on first issue type

h3. Expected Results
Issue is associates to the workflow of the new issue type.

h3. Actual Results
Issue remains on the old workflow

h3. Workaround
Manually change the issue type via UI
fields.summary: Issues are not associated to the correct workflow when the issue type is updated by an Automation Rule
Links to files/images in comments are broken while sending email using Automation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some groups aren't displayed on Group Picker (single group), using the new issue view, if you have more than 20 groups with the same name and start with "#" string.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 20 groups with the name like "#SD - 1", "#SD - 2", "#SD - 3", ... , "#SD - 20"
 # Create a group with name like "#SD - Test"
 # Try to search for "#SD - Test" on a Group Picker (single group)

h3. Expected Results

The group is displayed 

h3. Actual Results

The group isn't displayed 

Notes: Groups with other names are still displayed if you search for them (examples: "Test group", "#abc"), and groups that have the same name but incude numbers "#SD - 21"

h3. Workaround

Use the old issue view
fields.summary: Groups aren't displayed on Group Picker (single group) if they have the same name and include "#" string, using the new issue view.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Browser becomes unresponsive/crashes when trying to preview a large attachment file.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. Attach a .txt file of size ~ 10+ MB in the issue.
2. Open the attached file, first, it becomes unresponsive for a few seconds and soon adds the blank background and after a few seconds all the data will populate, during this time browser tab was unresponsive.
3. Few .txt files will even fail to preview with an error *Something went wrong*
 !image-2020-11-20-20-55-29-076.png|thumbnail! 

4. In the chrome browser tab becomes unresponsive when tested in Firefox the entire browser crashes/unresponsive for some time.


h3. Expected Results
Even though the file is too large but the tab should not go unresponsive.

h3. Actual Results

Should be able to preview the file without any issues.

h3. Workaround

No workaround yet.
fields.summary: Browser becomes unresponsive/crashes when trying to preview a large attachment file.

fields.description:
Current behavior -
 * Install tempo and search for an issue in it to log time, it shows a different list in Jira vs Tempo as soon as we type project key

Expected behavior -
 * Consistency in the search results in Jira vs Tempo

We took feedback from the Tempo team and the feedback we got was -

Jira doesn’t provide the same API for the public as the one used for the default issue search
fields.summary: Improvements in API for search issue functionality in Jira

fields.description:
In the issue comment, you can see the option for user mentioning with “public name”. However you can't only in create issue screen. Different behavior on different screens makes the customer's experience worse.

In create issue screen:
 !スクリーンショット 2020-11-18 11.37.59 (1).png|thumbnail! 

In the detail view:
 !スクリーンショット 2020-11-18 11.36.37.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: ability to mention the user with public name in create issue screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *Assigned to Me* gadget is displaying tickets that are resolved (have a resolution), but it should only display tickets that are unresolved:

 !Assign to me.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a dashboard and add the *Assigned to Me* gadget
 # Create an issue and add a resolution to it, without relating the issue to a status with the category *Done* 

 !done.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The issue isn't displayed at the *Assigned to Me* gadget because it has a resolution.

h3. Actual Results

The issue is displayed at the *Assigned to Me* gadget, and it will stop displaying if you transition it to a status with the category *Done* (the green ones).

h3. Workaround

- Use the *Filter results* gadget to display the information.

OR

- Transition the ticket to a status of the category *Done*. (not the most recommend, because when the bug is fixed this won't be a valid solution, as the resolution shall be the source of truth)
fields.summary: The Assigned to Me gadget is displaying tickets that are resolved (have a resolution)

fields.description:
Please stop imposing double line (i.e. paragraph) spacing by default. Please give us an easy way of turning it off. Holding shift for each new line is awkward and can actually cause discomfort in your hand when you have to type a lot.

 

The interface is becoming more bulky, cumbersome, and annoying.

 

Please. Please. Please stop making things worse.

 

Thanks! Or should I say...

 

 

 

 

 

 

Thanks!
fields.summary: Line Spacing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the issue comment, you can see the option for user mentioning with “public name”. However you can't only in create issue screen. Different behavior on different screens makes the customer's experience worse.

In create issue screen:
 !スクリーンショット 2020-11-18 11.37.59.png|thumbnail!

In the detail view:
 !スクリーンショット 2020-11-19 18.20.52.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open create issue screen
 # Type @"_public name_" in Description

h3. Expected Results

The option for user mentioning is shown
h3. Actual Results

The option for user mentioning is not shown
h3. Workaround

The only way to see the option is to type "full name"
fields.summary: Can't mention the user with public name only in create issue screen

fields.description:
{panel:title=Implementation of New Features Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
 You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

When project admins visit the *Default Field Configuration*, they can see the fields added in the next-gen projects. When they try to edit the configuration, there's no field appeared because the next-gen fields are only available per project.

 !Screen Shot 2020-11-19 at 16.35.04.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Suggested Solution

Add a badge to clarify that the field is added for the classic/next-gen project, like the "LOCKED" ones.
 [https://EXAMPLE.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewIssueFields.jspa|https://example.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewIssueFields.jspa]
h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.

You can tell whether the field has a project scope via the REST API.
 [https://EXAMPLE.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/field|https://example.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/field]
fields.summary: Clarify the fields configurad in the next-gen project are only available per project at the Default Field Configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Automation rules created to replicate the comment from the issue in JSM project to the linked issues in the JSW project copies the same comment twice in the JSW/JSM project even though the option "Prevent duplicates by only adding this comment once to a particular issue" is chosen.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a rule with trigger -> issue commented. 
 # Add branch/related issue -> linked issues (All link types)
 # Action -> add comment -> ensure to have the options enabled to 
 ** Prevent duplicates by only adding this comment once to a particular issue
 ** Share with customer
 # Save the rule

When the comment is added on the JSM project issue -> comment is added twice on JSW project linked issue and vice versa.
h3. Expected Results

The comment should be added only once in the JSW/JSM project linked issue.
h3. Actual Results

The comment is added twice on the JSW/JSM project linked issue. 

!Comments duplication.gif|width=398,height=166!
h3. Workaround

Uncheck the option "Share with customer".
fields.summary: A4J: Comments created twice when copying from JSM <-> JSW linked issues.

fields.description:
In many projects the Summary field does not make sense to the end users creating issues - as demonstrated by many Community questions.

The field can be easily removed from Create issue screen, resulting in errors at issue creation, with no intuitive instructions on how to fix this.

While there are ways to pre-populate it on the Create issue screen and then changing it behind the scenes, they all include custom JS, groovy scripting or 3rd party apps.

Having a simple setting in project configuration, called "Default summary" would make it easier for many admins to not include this field on Create issue screen.

This would remove the need for this documented workaround:
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-set-default-value-for-summary-field-in-jira-800692650.html]
fields.summary: Set default Summary value in project configuration

fields.description:
I would like to have more than one priority field - not different priorities (as in Priority Schemes), but different field for different project, depending on their methodology, e.g.:
 * Priority - Jira default field, values e.g. Low/Medium/High
 * Severity - custom field, values e.g. P1/P2/P3/P4
 * Business priority - Must have/Medium/Nice to have

A new type of custom field would be necessary - "Priority".

The values would be picked from existing priorities defined in Jira instance, and it would use the same style and icons.
fields.summary: New type of custom field - priority
Dropdowns widths are limited to 250px including for Project Picker

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When moving an issue from one project to another and the destination project has set a default assignee, the issue doesn't change the assignee to the default one.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue from project x;
# Move it for project y, where there is a default assignee;
# The assignee keeps the same as before;

h3. Expected Results
If an issue is moved from one project to another one the default assignee should be updated automatically with the default assignee of the new project.

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens, keep the same assignee

h3. Workaround

Create automation when an issue is moved, assign to the default assignee:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Default assignee should be updated if an issue is moved to another project
Add "Components" and "Versions" filter to JIRA roadmap

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When saving a new filter in the issue search page and open the column drop-down filter pane the selections are unchecked if you refresh the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a previously created filter
 # Refresh the page and click on "save as" to save a new filter
 # In the list view click on columns and filter pane
 # You will notice that all fields are unchecked instead of retaining the default or previous ones

In the video below I show how the fields are kept if a new filter is saved normally but when you refresh the page and save a new filter the fields in the filter pane are unchecked.
https://share.getcloudapp.com/8Lun21D8

h3. Expected Results
The filtered fields should be kept

h3. Actual Results
All fields are unchecked

h3. Workaround
Avoid refreshing the page before saving a new filter
fields.summary: The filter option in the columns drop-down field from the issue search uncheck all the options

fields.description:
As a rule writer

I want to export a rule from the Automation Playground

So I can use the existing rule as a starting point for my own projects' rules

 

The automation playground may be found here: https://docs.automationforjira.com/rule-playground

 

Acceptance Criteria
 * Can select one or more rules for export from the playground
 * An exported rule's JSON can be imported into another project/Jira instance
 * Bonus: documentation for automation provides use case examples, including a downloadable JSON for the explained rule
fields.summary: add export for rules in Automation Playground

fields.description: In comments, the time of the comment is expressed with markup like the following: {{ }} {{ 5 days ago}}   *Actual Behavior* When I hover over the "5 days ago" to see the actual time stamp, I see the text from the wrapper span's title attribute (i.e. "11/12/20 3:42 AM").   *Expected Behavior* When I hover over the "5 days ago" to see the actual time stamp, I see the text from the wrapper {{time}} element's {{datetime}} attribute formatted according to my system locale. ("2020-11-12 22:42:00-0800" with my current localization settings)   The *whole point* of the {{@datetime}} attribute is to allow *user agents* to format the date time according to the user's locale rules. My browser _would_ do the right thing. However, this hover text gets trumped by the wrapper {{span}}'s {{title}} attribute value.
fields.summary: Do not localize date-times in title attributes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The shortcut Command+Enter (on Mac) to create an issue, is not working for some users
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to the create issue screen (either service desk or classic Jira)
 # Enter all required fields
 # Press Command + Enter on a Mac

This is occurring on both Chrome and Firefox
h3. Expected Results

Pressing Command + Enter will create the issue
h3. Actual Results

Nothing occurs
fields.summary: Pressing Command + Enter (on Mac) from the create issue screen does not create the issue for some users

fields.description:
h3. *Problem:* 

When adding a comment with an issue key on Jira Cloud for Mac, it's not automatically converted to a clickable link with the issue type, summary, and status as the web version. It only happens if adding the entire URL.
h3. *Suggesting:*

When adding a valid issue key, it should be automatically converted.

!Screen Shot 2020-11-17 at 16.13.55.png|width=446,height=385!
fields.summary: When adding an issue key on a comment in Jira Cloud for Mac, it should be automatically converted to a clickable link the same as the Web version

fields.description:
h3. Summary

It is possible to restrict custom fields' context, making them available only to specific projects. 

But, as a consequence, those fields will not be displayed as options during the field mapping step in the CSV import (external system import) process unless you are importing issues into a single project that is applied to the available context(s).

Given that the import functionality can be used for larger administrative tasks, such as importing a big number of issues into several projects at the same time, it might require a lot of manual work in case you need to change a big number of fields' contexts so they can be mapped during the import process.

h3. Suggestion

Make it possible to map fields with restricted context during the CSV import, and have Jira handle properly if the field is not applicable for a certain project, preventing any values from being created during the import in the issues of those projects, but preserving the ones that can receive such values.
fields.summary: Ability to map fields with restricted context during CSV import

fields.description:
Option to include additional tab for columns when using Advanced Search with JQL. 

Currently, we have only *My Default* & *System* tabs to filter the columns when using JQL. 

An option to create and save custom columns would be helpful.
fields.summary: Option to include additional tab for columns when using Advanced Search.

fields.description: After I click the "Assigned to me" on the page "Your work", all the issues assigned to me will be shown up ranked by the status like "In progress" or "To Do". It is not easy for me to know the priorities or the order of the issues, is it possible to provide the function to configure the columns to display and sort in order of specific columns like "Due date"?
fields.summary: “Assigned to me” in "Your work"

fields.description:
Currently, status need to be selected through a drop-down list:

!image-2020-11-16-17-53-58-330.png|width=234,height=191!

This makes sense for workflows which have a lot of possible transition. However, for simple workflows, it would be good to have the possibility to only click on buttons as it used to work in old issue view:

!image-2020-11-16-17-55-08-936.png|width=519,height=147!
fields.summary: Statuses to be shown as buttons instead of a unique drop-down button list

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Only users to whom the Administer Project permission / Administration access was granted will be able to use the Configure feature on Issue Detail View. However, the Configure option is shown to any user.
h3. Expected Results

Considering that the user won't be able to update the issue detail view configuration, this option might be hidden to avoid confusion.
h3. Actual Results

Currently, if one user don't have this, the _Configure_ gear will be shown greyed out and a warning message will be presented one he/she clicks on it:

!image-2020-11-16-17-14-42-323.png|width=414,height=261!
fields.summary: Configure gear for Issue Detail View should not be shown if user does not have needed permission

fields.description:
As a rule writer

I want the rules list to include the last execution date/time

So I can manage my rules more effectively

 

Acceptance criteria:
 * Rule list columns includes Last Execution Date/Time
 * Last Execution Date/Time supports sorting the list
 * Bonus: list of rules allows filtering by Last Execution Date/Time
 * Bonus: list of rules allows selection of columns, including Last Execution Date/Time, Last Update Date/Time, author, etc.
 * Bonus: project-level view of rules allow multiple selection for export and deletion
fields.summary: add Last Execution Date/Time to rules list

fields.description:
Currently, when we move issues from projects, Jira doesn't consider the older value (Issue Key) that issue had, it actually "appends" that issue at the end of the project only.

Example:
 * The issue ABC-100 was moved to the project XYZ.
 * After that, the issue has inherited the name XYZ-*N+1* (last issue plus 1).
 * Once you move this XYZ-N+1 to the project ABC again, it'll search for the last issue created (it'll consider deleted issues also) and will add that issue respecting the increment of 1, therefore, it'll be added as ABC-*N+1*, not ABC-100, as it was before.

As a user that moves lots of issues in bulk actions, it would be great if issues like this came back with the former Issue Key.
fields.summary: Consider the Former Issue Key once moving an issue
Calling POST /rest/api/3/jql/match with assignee in JQL returns incorrect match result

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Automation usage is not keeping the track of *Usage history* for Global or multi-project rules.
Hence it is not possible to identify which rule has consumed the usage in the past from the *Usage in the last 30 days* section.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to Global rule and click on usage.
 # Let us assume that a rule is already a Global rule or a multi-project rule and has many rules executed already. (This will ow show up in usage history under *Usage in the last 30 days* section.)
# Now if you change the configuration of. this rule and restrict to a specific project, the rule gets disappeared from this usage section.

h3. Expected Results
* Executed rules in past should still be visible under the  *Usage in the last 30 days* section.

h3. Actual Results

The rule gets disappeared. 

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Automation usage should continue to show rules for the month that are no longer global/multi

fields.description:
Please add a new Jira automation trigger: _Issue status category changed_, so that rules can be triggered when an issue status category changes. It should be possible to chose from and to categories or leave unset to include all similar to how it works with _Issue transitioned_ trigger.

*Current workaround*

Currently the only workaround I could come up with is using Trigger: Issue transitioned combined with Condition: Issue matches JQL like: "statusCategory != "To Do" AND statusCategoryChangedDate >= startOfDay()" however this is inefficient because it triggers on every transition, rather than only when the status category changes (resulting in unnecessary executions). Reducing the scope of Trigger: Issue transitioned by constraining listing all statuses relevant for that status category in the From/To status field, is impractical and unmaintainable because in our instance we have many statuses and new ones get added all the time. It would be much simpler and useful if there was a trigger for _Issue status category changed_.
fields.summary: New trigger: Issue status category changed

fields.description:
Please add a new Jira automation trigger: _Issue resolved_, so that rules can be triggered upon resolution of an issue.

*Current workaround*

Currently the only workaround I could come up with is using Trigger: _Issue transitioned_ combined with Condition: _Issue matches JQL_: "resolution is not EMPTY". However this is inefficient because it triggers on every transition, rather than only when the issue is resolved (resulting in unnecessary executions). Reducing the scope of Trigger: _Issue transitioned_ by constraining listing all resolved type statuses in the To status field, is impractical and unmaintainable because in our instance we have many resolved type statuses and new ones get added all the time. It would be much simpler and useful if there was a trigger for _Issue resolved_
fields.summary: New trigger: Issue resolved

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users can access/see projects from products they have no access at the Administration page
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Grant a user access to only one Jira product
 # Access as this user at Jira

h3. Expected Results

The user should only see/access the projects that match their Product Access
h3. Actual Results

Users can see/access projects that are not part of their configuration. Please see the attached video:
 [^screencast-admin.atlassian.com-2020.10.26-14_37_18.webm]
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Product Access configuration from the Administration page is not respected on Jira instances

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the New Issue view, there is no option to create Epic child in another project directly as in the Old issue view. So the user will have to move the Epic child to another project or create a new issue and then fill the Epic link option.  This is applicable to both Classic and NextGen Software projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Epic in a Jira Software project
 # Take the New Issue view and then create a child issue.
 # There is no option to select the project here. So the child issue will always be created under the current project.
 # You need to move the child issue to another project if required.
 # In the Old issue view, when you create a child project, there is an option to select the project of the child issue.

h3. Expected Results

When Epic child is created in the New Issue view, it should provide the option to select the project also.
h3. Actual Results

NA
h3. Workaround

User can select any of the below workarounds

1) Create the Epic child and move it to another project.

2) Create a new issue using the "Create" button on the top frame. Here you have the option to select a project. Use the Epic Link field to link the issue to the Epic.
fields.summary: Ability to create Epic child in another project directly in New Issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to un-star a Project when your Browse project permission is removed
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a classic project
 # Star the project
 # Remove your browse project permission (via Permissions Scheme).
 # Observe error when attempting to remove the star from the created project, under the drop-down option

h3. Expected Results
Should be able to remove the star
h3. Actual Results
Error message:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround

Add the user back to the browse project permission so they can un-star the project and remove them after the change is made
fields.summary: Unable to un-star a Project when your Browse project permission is removed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we order by *Fix version* via *advanced JQL*, the order by will be based on the sequence added when we created the fix version. *However, this should be ordered by fix version name*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 #  Create *fix version 1.1.* (Jira will add the sequence 1).
 # Create *version 1.3.* (Jira will add the sequence 2).
 # Then create *version 1.2*. (Jira will add the sequence 3). 
 # Then if we try to order by fix version via JQL advanced, the order will be based on the creating sequence.

h3. Expected Results

When we order by *fix version* is ordered by fix version id/sequence of fix version creation.
h3. Actual Results

The order by fix version will be by the sequence of the fix version creation, instead of the fix version name.
 * I've recorded this *[video|https://share.getcloudapp.com/ApuLpjxw]* showing the behavior.

h3. Workaround

No workaround found.
fields.summary: Fix version should be ordered by name instead of the sequence creating

fields.description:
*Use case* - 

Slack alert to be triggered when a Bug's priority is changed from "Critical" to "High"

 

Currently, there is no way to apply this level of filtration where issue type and a change in field value is detected based on which slack notification is triggered.
fields.summary: Slack alert when a particular field value is changed for a specific issue type

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
X-ray settings doesn't load on full page for Next-gen projects and it only provides a scrolling bar within the available space.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install, X-Ray plugin for Jira cloud.
 # Navigate to the App section for Next-gen
# Access the X-Ray settings

h3. Expected Results
X-Ray settings should load on full page as it loads for Classic projects.

h3. Actual Results
Does not load on full page.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: X-Ray settings doesn't load on full page for Next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Jira notification panel of one user show issue status in the local language of the other user who performs the action

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set language1 for User1 in their personal settings and language2 for User2 and the default Jira language is set as language 2
# User1 reports an issue and the issue is assigned to User2
# User1 mentions User2 in a comment 
# User2 gets notified regarding the above update

h3. Expected Results
User2 views the notification in language2

h3. Actual Results
User2 gets the actual comment in language2 as expected, however, the status of the issue is in language1

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Notification panel of one user shows issue status in the local language of the other user who performs the action

fields.description:
With Automation for Jira to trigger a rule due to the time that a status is being used you need to use SLAs. This work around makes creating these rules more complicated.

We would like to ask for the addition of a Time in Status trigger to the Automation for Jira. 
This trigger exists in Legacy Automation.
fields.summary: Add a Time in Status trigger to Automation for Jira.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When importing the parent and Subtask issues in a Next-gen Project using the CSV import, the link is properly created between the parent and the sub-task issue, however, it does not display in the subtask and parent issue screen.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a CSV file containing a parent and a child issue. E.g:

 
{quote}{{Summary,Issue id,Issue Type,Parent id}}
 {{test summary,37660,Bug,,}}
 {{test sub-task summary,,Subtask,37660}}
{quote}
# Import the CSV file to a Next-gen project using the *External System Import*, selecting the project in the import client

 
h3. Expected Results

The issue is created and the link displayed in the issue view.
h3. Actual Results

Both issues are created and the link displayed in the issue navigator, however, the link is not displayed in the issue view of both parent and sub-task, differently from when creating the parent and subtask using the UI:

!Screen Shot 2020-11-11 at 19.23.46.png|width=445,height=174!
 !Screen Shot 2020-11-11 at 19.25.13.png|width=458,height=71!
h3. Workaround
 # Manually link the issues after the import, optionally using the [bulk update|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/edit-multiple-issues-at-the-same-time/] if there are many subtasks linked to the same parent
 OR
 # Import the issues to a Classic project, moving them to the correct Next-gen project posteriorly
fields.summary: Sub-task link not displayed in Next-gen when imported through CSV

fields.description: When I hover over a flag on a flagged issue I would like to see the comment that was entered for that flagged item.
fields.summary: Hover text on issue flag

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The check box option did not work when we click on the box to select a project role permission in Next-Gen Projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on *Project setting* >> *Access*
 # Click on *Manage Roles*, duplicate an existing role or edit a custom one and try to click in a permission checkbox to select it.

h3. Expected Results

This should mark as checked when we click on the check box option.
 
h3. Actual Results

The option will not be marked.
 
h3. Workaround

We need to click on the permission text box.
fields.summary: The check box option did not work when we click on the box to select a project role permission in Next-Gen Projects

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 20 July 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#2684ff|titleBGColor=#2684ff|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for your feedback on this ticket. We have now resolved this and the _automatic_ option is now available in the Assignee field in the new issue view. 

Thanks

Tha Atlassian Cloud team
{panel}
In the new issue view, the *Automatic* option for the Assignee field is not present as it used to be in the old issue view.

Jira users would like to keep this functionality for the new issue view.
fields.summary: Add the 'Automatic' option to the Assignee field on the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user is using the attachment carousel on iOS (the top bar paper-clip button) to add attachments to an issue, the upload fails intermittently

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Using the iOS app, open an issue
# Tap on the top bar paper-clip button to add an attachment to the issue
# Pickup a file

h3. Expected Results

The attachment is added to the issue without problems

h3. Actual Results

Attachments upload fail intermittently

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Attachments upload fail intermittently in the iOS app

fields.description: The font color RED available in the new issue view is not the same available in the old issue view. The font color available in the old issue view (#d04437) is brighter than the font color available in the new issue view (#ff5630). It would be great if the actual RED font color is available in the new issue view.
fields.summary: Font color is not the same in issue creation and description

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If the Edit Issue permission is set to the Reporter when changing the Epic Link of an Issue, an event is fired in the Activity Log but the value doesn't actually change (changes not saved).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the Edit Issue permission to *Reporter* 
 !Reporter.png|thumbnail! 
 # Change the Epic link of an issue

h3. Expected Results
Epic link changed to a new value

h3. Actual Results
Nothing is changed and the event is logged as if something was changed.
 !Epic Link Failed to update.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

* This only impacts Epic link. Other fields worked as expected
* Edit permission could be granted to a specific project role/group.
fields.summary: Reporter edit permission can't persist Epic link change

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion

There are chances of existing lengthy_ formatted descriptions being overwritten due to browser caching.

It would be good to have a prompt message if all the content is being wiped off.
fields.summary: Jira should prompt message if all the content of the description field is overwritten

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira incoming handler's issue creation code does not invoke webhook event generation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an incoming mail Jira handler which creates issues
 # Send email
 # issue_created Webhook event is not created

h3. Expected Results

Jira incoming handler's issue creation code has to invoke webhook event generation.
h3. Actual Results

My connect app is not getting “issue created” webhooks from a specific Jira project.
h3. Workaround

- None
fields.summary: Jira incoming handler's issue creation code does not invoke webhook event generation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Tickets in Service Desk next-gen projects assigned to the user are not being shown in the default filters My Open Issues / Open Issues
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a Service Desk Next-gen project
 # Create a ticket and assign to yourself
 # Check the default filters My Open Issues / Open Issues

h3. Expected Results

The ticket is listed under the default filters My Open Issues / Open Issues
h3. Actual Results

No tickets are shown in the default filters My Open Issues / Open Issues
h3. Workaround
 * For "My open issues": Create a custom filter with query:

{code:java}
assignee = currentUser() AND statusCategory in (2, 4) order by updated DESC
{code}
 * For "Open issues": Create a custom filter with query:

{code:java}
statusCategory in (2, 4) order by priority DESC,updated DESC
{code}
fields.summary: Service Desk, Next-gen and Classic issues are not showing under the default filters My Open Issues and Open Issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira history is displaying "None" as a previous value of the Fix Versions field.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Change the fix version value
 # Check in the history how the transition from one value to another is displayed. For example, change from 1 to 2, then 2 to 3

h3. Expected Results

Taking as example the one suggested above:
 You should see in the history:
 1 -> 2
 2-> 3
h3. Actual Results

You will see:
 None -> 2
 None -> 3

Example:
 !image-2020-11-11-19-28-49-655.png!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Changing the "field version" value is being displayed in ticket issue with the original value as NONE

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding or removing a project role under *Project Settings > People* to an user, the role is only toggle if you click the text, and not the actual checkbox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # got to *Project Settings > People*
 # click the dropdown for any user
 # click the checkbox for a project role

h3. Expected Results

The user is granted that role, or removed from it

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens. Recorded this .gif demonstrating it: https://share.getcloudapp.com/nOun08J9

h3. Workaround
Click the text instead.
fields.summary: Clicking checkbox on Project Role dropdown has no effect

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Radio buttons custom field set as required and with a default value still shows "None" as an option.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a radio button custom field and add some options.
 # Select one of the options as the default one.
 # On a classic project, set this field as required.

h3. Expected Results

On the edit issue screen, it only shows the options that admins added on the field.

!Screen Shot 2020-11-11 at 18.16.16.png|width=338,height=122!
h3. Actual Results

It still shows "None" as an option and if the user selects "None" it shows an error.

!Screen Shot 2020-11-11 at 18.11.20.png|width=268,height=127!

!Screen Shot 2020-11-11 at 18.11.39.png|width=278,height=72!
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Radio buttons custom field set as required and with a default value still shows "None" as an option

fields.description:
As a product manager I get a lot of notifications and I want to be able to review and groom them more quickly. 

I want to be able to navigate up and down through notifications (as I do in issue views), and clear ones that do not require followup, so that only the actionable notifications remain, as a reminder to deal with them.

Examples of necessary keyboard shortcuts: 
 * next/prev notification in notification view  (cmd+arrow, same as navigating issues would be nice)
 * clear selected notification

Right now I have to click on each notification and then right-click and choose clear to remove it, which is quite slow and cumbersome.
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcuts for navigating notifications in Mac native app

fields.description:
It would be nice if we can connect multiple spaces in jira project.

Currently macro "Include page" is not showing content in the kba in JSD portal if it contains content from a different space.
fields.summary: Ability to link multiple confluence spaces in JSD project

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*

Long names of the projects are not displayed in full to select from, when customer tries to create a ticket from outside of the project. 

*Suggested Solution*

A feature to expand the project name field box or to display the project name with hovering of mouse on it.

*Why this is important*

Customers finds it difficult to select the correct project to create a ticket as there are multiple project names that start with same sequence words, but have different ending. Customer feedback was that it is tedious to click on project name filed each time to manually make sure he is choosing the correct project to create the ticket in.
fields.summary: Long names of the projects are not displayed in full.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While logging time in the log work window, the *Insert Link* option is not saving the link, the text added in the *Work Description* field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Jira, set time tracking to *Jira Time tracking*
 # Open an issue > Log work > Enter some time and in the *Work Description* field > Click on +V (/Insert) shortcut > Link
# Add a link (for example https://www.atlassian.com/) and add some text in *Text to display*
# Try to save the link and the text entered
 
h3. Expected Results
Using the *Insert link* option, users should be able to save links in the *Work description* field

h3. Actual Results
Unable to add links in the Work description field

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to add links using Insert links option in the Work description field

fields.description:
Resolution gadget does not take into consideration wherein the workflow a ticket is, but rather a static look if the ticket has a resolution or not.

A gadget that can look at issues in a dynamic manner and time spend field would be of great help.
fields.summary: An inbuilt gadget similar to resolution one, that instead of looking at the time between creation and resolve date, looks at time spent on various stages

fields.description:
Hello, 

 

We would like to see the status of the automation rules directly in the dashboards, this way we could monitor them and be aware in case that we are experiencing some issues or if there's one that it's not working.

Have a nice day!
fields.summary: Check the status of the automation rules on the dashboards

fields.description:
h3. Summary

 

The bug is related to the new issue-view and custom addons(Threaded Comments) integrated on activity tabs.

 
h3. Description:

 The system is not calling the addon page at all, If click too fast to the tab from Addon Under Activity.
h3. Steps to Reproduce:

It can be reproduced.
 Open an issue and you click fast to the Threaded Comments tab before the whole page is fully loaded, you will see that the page remains blank and the Threaded Comment app is never called.
 You can check the screenshot in the attachment that no API call is done and that the page remains empty.

!image-2020-11-11-11-33-55-030.png|width=1202,height=728!  

!image-2020-11-11-11-33-29-487.png|width=946,height=360!
h3. Workaround:

No workaround at present
fields.summary: no API call is done for  custom addons(Threaded Comments) in new Issue view when the tab is clicked too fast

fields.description:
Availability to hide/enable third-party apps to show by Project, as not all users should have access to view or use them, and they are shown on the left-side panel and also on the top right corner of the project boards.

We know that third-party apps are not controlled by Atlassian but on Confluence the left-side panel for spaces is customizable, and this could be implemented also for Jira.
fields.summary: Availability to hide/enable third-party apps to show by Project

fields.description:
Honestly as a general comment you need to reflect the features that are allowed in first-level issues, for subtasks much more thoroughly. 

There seems to be missing pieces for subtasks that would accelerate a workflow if said features existed. 

This is another one of those: allow linking a confluence page to a subtask, as is done in a normal JIRA issue.
fields.summary: Link Confluence pages to subtasks in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Filter columns get reset to Default columns when trying to move one column to a different place and it does not even show the dotted green lines when you select the column you try to move
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Filter with more than 20 columns selected
 # Attempt to move the last column to a different place
 # Open the Columns drop-down menu and it will show the Default ones selected only

h3. Expected Results
The filter should maintain the columns according to the selection when it was created
h3. Actual Results
The filter shows the default columns

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Filter columns get reset to Default columns when trying to move one column to a different place

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira won't allow users to delete a screen that's associated with a trashed project. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project.
# Move one project to the trash.
# Try to delete the screens associated with that project

h3. Expected Results

The screens can be deleted

h3. Actual Results

- The screens remain active and cannot be deleted

 h3. Workaround

No workaround is other than deleting/restoring the project in the trash can.
fields.summary: Screens associated with trashed projects remain active.

fields.description:
When selecting the labels field as the XAxis or YAxis in the Two Dimensional filter gadget today, it displays every single label in the issues returned by the filter.

It would be great if there was a mechanism to decide which labels should be displayed in the gadget between the ones filled in the issues.
fields.summary: Select which labels should be displayed in the Two Dimensional filter gadget

fields.description: When a user is added to the site-admins groups, the user isn't notified of that and it would be useful to know when you get administrative rights in Jira.
fields.summary: As a Jira user, I want to be notified when I'm added to administration groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1
 # Step 2

h3. Expected Results
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Required, if there is no workaround please state:
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Test
Automation rule throws error when the organisation list is too long

fields.description:
It would be useful to make Labels inline the way epic label is shown.

Hi, if I decide to display labels on the cards the label is displayed below the title of the card which doubles the height of a card. But next to the title there is plenty of space so I'd suggest to display the label there.

Otherwise the backlog becomes much more unreadable as before...
fields.summary: Labels inline in backlog

fields.description:
Customers using annual billing currently have no easy way to automate the auditing of license consumption per-site.
In order to allow the automation of auditing, and notifications centered directly around the consumption of licenses, I would like to propose that the Jira REST API include endpoints to allow this information to be accessed by site admins via scripts.
fields.summary: Add License Count and Consumption information to REST API

fields.description:
As a rule writer

I want to copy and paste (clone) components within a rule

So I can rapidly create rules which have repeated branches, conditions, and actions

 

Acceptance criteria:
 * Branch, condition, and action components can be cloned
 * When a component is cloned, it is placed immediately below its source component
 * When a branch is cloned, the child components of the branch are also cloned
 * When a condition is cloned, the child components of the condition are also cloned
 * Bonus: cloning can occur manually by editing a JSON rule file, leaving the component identifiers blank, and then importing the rule for a project.

Business case:

The user interface for rule automation allows rapid creation of rules in most ways, except for adding components.  When rules have a repeated pattern, there is no work-around other than to add each component, one by one.  Providing a component clone feature will dramatically speed up the creation of such rules.

.
fields.summary: add copy-n-paste (component cloning) in automation rules
Using CascadeOption(Parent,none) in JQL breaks results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you subscribe to filter, you receive an email that shows properly the Public Names of the users, but it is missing the subscriber (yourself). Ensure all names appearing in the subscription are the public names to correctly identify users. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a filter
 # subscribe to the filter.
 # Inspect the subscription email 
 !image-2020-08-18-10-56-44-607.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
All usernames/accountId should be replaced by the Public name.

h3. Actual Results
The mails contain the usernames which are deprecated. 

h3. Workaround
Look up the list of exported users to match the values.
fields.summary: The subscriber in the Filter Subscription displays the username

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Service Desk portal-only customer accounts can be assigned issues on Business and Software projects if they're added to a project role with Browse Projects and Assignable user permissions

*Update* this also applies to Atlassian Accounts with no licenses.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk portal-only customer account:
#* !Screen Shot 2020-11-09 at 11.11.26.png|thumbnail! 
# Add a project role to the Browse Projects and Assignable user permissions on a permission scheme being used by a Business or Software project;
# Add the customer account to the project role
#* !Screen Shot 2020-11-09 at 11.08.19.png|thumbnail! 
# Access any issue on the project and try assinging it to the customer

h3. Expected Results

*Jira should prevent those users from being assigned tickets, as they do not have any licenses*

h3. Actual Results

You're able to assign the issue to the customer account

* !Screen Shot 2020-11-09 at 11.10.10.png|thumbnail! 

*Note:* On Service Desk projects, even if the project role is also assigned the Service Desk Agent permission, it is not possible to assign issues to customers:
* !Screen Shot 2020-11-09 at 11.15.25.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JSD customer accounts can be assigned to issues on classic Business and Software projects

fields.description:
Customer wants to see the language sorted by alphabetical order so it is easy to search for the same. Screenshots attached below for reference.

https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences?ref=jira&src=personalsettings
https://id.atlassian.com/manage-profile/account-preferences
fields.summary: Sort language by order in personal settings/account preferences

fields.description:
Currently, you can witch between relative and absolute formats by clicking on the timestamp in the issue view. However in the filtered list, we will see Date Time Picker fields as relative date when the date of the fields is <= 7 days.
 !スクリーンショット 2020-11-09 15.26.43.png|thumbnail! 

Request to be able to enable absolute date for Date Time Picker in the filtered list.
fields.summary: Enabling Absolute Date for Date Time Picker in the filtered list

fields.description:
When you need to filter the options of each field on issue navigator, you can't use "exact match". For example, If you type "Test User" in the Assignee field, you will also see "Test Name" and "Name User" as options. There should be a way to show only "Test User".
 !スクリーンショット 2020-11-09 11.20.59.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: The ability to display the list of options filtered  with exact match on issue navigator

fields.description:
Hi,

My workflow is such that I use a central Jira board titled "Projects List" to track everything I am doing at a high level. Each project is designated to a particular focus, whether internally or externally, that I am assigned within my current job title. 

I use subtasks quite a lot, but it would be extremely useful to have subtasks of subtasks.  

For example, Project Management is one of my high-level tasks. I have to project manage a particular client where we have deployed a number of consultants. Each consultant is a subtask and I would then like to have each of their concerns as a subtask of that subtask (and if you really wanted to go crazy, make the notes on that subtask a subtask of a subtask of a subtask). For now I just use comments but then I can't track the progress you see?

Yes, I could make a project for Project Management and all of my other concerns but then I don't get the advantage of tracking all of my concerns centrally and placing my immediate focus in "In Progress", whilst peripheral focus projects remain in "To Do" and I don't completely forget about them over time. This way of working is extremely useful for re-prioritizing as priorities shift and following up on long-burn projects. If I could get subtasks of subtasks my workflow would be infinitely more powerful. If I could get subtasks of subtasks of subtasks I would never use anything else.
fields.summary: Infinitely recursive subtasks (or at least 2-3 levels deep)

fields.description:
When you use the filter pane from the column drop-down box in the search issue page seeing a saved filter the results displayed are only for the selected fields and the issue key is not displayed, when you filter an empty field no data is displayed.
 !image-2020-11-06-19-08-20-208.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Keep the issue key when using the filter options from the column drop-down box while viewing a saved filter on the search page

fields.description:
The subtask has the deployment status but there is no information displayed at the parent task. 
When displaying a parent task in Jira and you have a list of subtasks in it, it would be nice to have in the list the deployment status of each of the sub-tasks.
fields.summary: Display the deployment status of subtask on parent issue

fields.description:
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new field (any type) or rename an existing one adding an apostrophe (').
 # Go to Jira search (basic) and add the field to the criteria
 # Click on the field

h3. Expected Results

A dropdown menu appears with field options to be selected
h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens
h3. Workaround

Use advanced mode (JQL)
fields.summary: Basic search doesn't show options of fields that have an apostrophe in the name

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, neither the bulk operation screen includes *Linked issues* as an option nor the issue view has an option to bulk update/remove linked issues.

In some cases, that might require a lot of manual work due to a high number of linked issues.

h3. Suggestion

Offer a way to bulk update/remove linked issues.
fields.summary: Ability to perform bulk operations towards linked issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you expand the advanced search text box with a big query that takes the whole page's vertical size, a scroll bar is added inside the text box but not on the page itself, so the results of the query are pushed down and not accessible.
Also, after deleting the text, the text box doesn't shrink down accordingly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to *Advanced Search*.
# Write a query or input line skips inside the text box so it expands and fills the page.
# Try to scroll down the page to see the filter results.

h3. Expected Results

When the search box expands and pushes the results down the page should get a vertical scroll bar or the search box should be in a separate panel.

h3. Actual Results

The search box expands but the page is not vertically scrollable, so the results get pushed down and are only visible if the page is zoomed out but they become too small to be readable.

h3. Workaround

The search results can be exported using the *Export* button at the top right of the page. This allows users to view the obtained data and use it to access issues back in jira.
fields.summary: Writing so many lines in the advanced search text box that it takes the page's size doesn't allow to see results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Try to move ( drag and drop) some column is not working and The column stays in in its original place
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1- Create a JQL and make sure you have selected 25 columns to be displayed

2- Run your JQL , Notice that you can move any Visible column

3- Scroll horizontally to see the last column .

4- It is not possible to move this last column

5- Actually a certain number of columns before the last one are affected

6- Issue reproducible on Chrome, Firefox and IE
h3. Expected Results

Column can be moved ( drag and drop)
h3. Actual Results

Not possible to move some columns 

h3. Workaround

Reduce the number of columns to be displayed to 20 or less
fields.summary: Can't move columns
